entry.title: Modding:Console commands
entry.summary:
Farm buildings: add buildcoop command

← Older revision Revision as of 02:35, 21 March 2025

|-
 
|-
 
{{/cmd
 
{{/cmd
−
   |command = clearActiveDialogueEvents
+
   |command = clearactivedialogueevents
 
   |desc    = Clears all active [[Modding:Dialogue#Conversation_topics|conversation topics]].
 
   |desc    = Clears all active [[Modding:Dialogue#Conversation_topics|conversation topics]].
 
}}
 
}}
 
{{/cmd
 
{{/cmd
−
   |command = db,speakTo
+
   |command = db,speakto
 
   |params  = {{t|S:npcName}}
 
   |params  = {{t|S:npcName}}
 
   |desc    = Shows a dialogue box with the current dialogue for the specified NPC. Name is a fuzzy match and will default to Pierre if not supplied. This does count as having spoken to that NPC today, and if they don't have any more dialogue right now, the message ''Stack empty'' will be output to the console.
 
   |desc    = Shows a dialogue box with the current dialogue for the specified NPC. Name is a fuzzy match and will default to Pierre if not supplied. This does count as having spoken to that NPC today, and if they don't have any more dialogue right now, the message ''Stack empty'' will be output to the console.
 
}}
 
}}
 
{{/cmd
 
{{/cmd
−
   |command = dialogue,addDialogue
+
   |command = dialogue,adddialogue
 
   |params  = {{t|S:npcName}},{{t|S:dialogueString}}
 
   |params  = {{t|S:npcName}},{{t|S:dialogueString}}
 
   |desc    = Sets the dialogue for the specified character to the specified string. Name is a fuzzy match, and NPC names containing spaces should be quoted (e.g. <code>debug dialogue "Some NPC" Some dialgoue text$h</code>. The dialogue string should start with a zero and everything after will be parsed. It can include tokens such as <samp>@</samp> for the farmer name and portrait commands; see [[Modding:Dialogue#Format|Dialogue]] for format specifics.
 
   |desc    = Sets the dialogue for the specified character to the specified string. Name is a fuzzy match, and NPC names containing spaces should be quoted (e.g. <code>debug dialogue "Some NPC" Some dialgoue text$h</code>. The dialogue string should start with a zero and everything after will be parsed. It can include tokens such as <samp>@</samp> for the farmer name and portrait commands; see [[Modding:Dialogue#Format|Dialogue]] for format specifics.

   |desc    = Shows a speech bubble saying ''"Hello! This is a test"'' above the specified NPC's head. Name is a fuzzy match.

   |params  = {{o|I:amount}}
 
   |params  = {{o|I:amount}}
 
   |desc    = Sets friendship of all animals who live (and are currently present) in the current location to the given amount. Default is 1000 (max).
 
   |desc    = Sets friendship of all animals who live (and are currently present) in the current location to the given amount. Default is 1000 (max).

 +
  |command = displaceanimals
 +
  |desc    = Goes through all buildings that can contain animals. For each animal in each building, tries to move the animal outside the building. Finally, clears the building of all animals that live there.
 
}}
 
}}

   |desc    = Goes through all Farm buildings and removes entries for animals which no longer live in that building.

}}

{{/cmd

  |command = befriendpets
 +
  |desc    = Gives the player 1000 friendship points with all pets.
 +
}}
 
{{/cmd
 
{{/cmd
 
   |command = cat
 
   |command = cat
 
   |params  = {{t|I:X}},{{t|I:Y}},{{o|I:breed}}
 
   |params  = {{t|I:X}},{{t|I:Y}},{{o|I:breed}}
 
   |desc    = Spawns a new [[Animals#Cat or Dog|Cat]] at the given coordinates of the current location. Breed can be <samp>0</samp>, <samp>1</samp>, <samp>2</samp>, <samp>3</samp>, <samp>4</samp>, or the <samp>Id</samp> of a [[Modding:Pets#Breeds|custom breed]] added by a mod, and determines which texture to use. This is an additional pet and does not replace any current pet(s).
 
   |desc    = Spawns a new [[Animals#Cat or Dog|Cat]] at the given coordinates of the current location. Breed can be <samp>0</samp>, <samp>1</samp>, <samp>2</samp>, <samp>3</samp>, <samp>4</samp>, or the <samp>Id</samp> of a [[Modding:Pets#Breeds|custom breed]] added by a mod, and determines which texture to use. This is an additional pet and does not replace any current pet(s).
 +
}}
 +
{{/cmd
 +
  |command = changepet
 +
  |params  = {{t|S:petName}},{{t|S:type}},{{o|S:breedId}}
 +
  |desc    = Changes the type and breed of an existing pet on the farm with name <samp>petName</samp>. <samp>type</samp> should match an ID in <samp>Data/Pets</samp>. Defaults to the first pet breed if none is specified.
 
}}
 
}}
 
{{/cmd
 
{{/cmd
Line 1,425: Line 1,438:
 
   |command = pettofarm
 
   |command = pettofarm
 
   |desc    = If it is not raining, warps your pet to the pet bowl location on the Farm (Tech note: Location is initially set by checking for tile 1938 on Building layer). If it is raining, warps pet to the FarmHouse. Only works for host in multiplayer.
 
   |desc    = If it is not raining, warps your pet to the pet bowl location on the Farm (Tech note: Location is initially set by checking for tile 1938 on Building layer). If it is raining, warps pet to the FarmHouse. Only works for host in multiplayer.
 +
}}
 +
{{/cmd
 +
  |command = setpreferredpet
 +
  |params  = {{t|S:type}},{{o|S:breedId}}
 +
  |desc    = Sets the player's preferred pet type and breed. <samp>type</samp> should match an ID in <samp>Data/Pets</samp>. Defaults to the first pet breed if none is specified.
 
}}
 
}}
 
{{/cmd
 
{{/cmd
Line 1,462: Line 1,480:
 
   |params  = {{t|I:eventID}},{{o|B:seeOrForget}}
 
   |params  = {{t|I:eventID}},{{o|B:seeOrForget}}
 
   |desc    = Marks specifid event as seen by your farmer. Useful for enabling access to event-dependent areas or events. You can forget an event (instead of adding it) by setting the second argument to false, like <samp>seenEvent <code><id></code> false</samp>.
 
   |desc    = Marks specifid event as seen by your farmer. Useful for enabling access to event-dependent areas or events. You can forget an event (instead of adding it) by setting the second argument to false, like <samp>seenEvent <code><id></code> false</samp>.
−
}}
 
−
{{/cmd
 
−
  |command = eventtest
 
−
  |params  = {{t|S:locationName}},{{t|I:eventIndex}}
 
−
  |desc    = Calls <samp>Util.EventTest()</samp> with the specified arguments. Defaults are "" and 0 respectively. Actual details unknown (not fully implemented).
 
−
}}
 
−
{{/cmd
 
−
  |command = eventtestspecific
 
−
  |params  = {{t|S:whichEvents}},{{o|...}}
 
−
  |desc    = Calls <samp>Util.EventTest()</samp> with the specified arguments. Arguments are interpreted as an array of strings. Actual details unknown (not fully implemented).
 
 
}}
 
}}
 
{{/cmd
 
{{/cmd
Line 1,745: Line 1,753:
 
   |desc    = Builds the specified building at the given coordinates. Names are case-insensitive, and will list fuzzy matches if an exact match isn't found. If the name includes spaces, quote them (e.g. <samp>"Junimo Hut"</samp>). If the coordinates are not specified, it will build just to the right of your farmer. While higher-level farm buildings such as Deluxe Barns can be immediately built this way, the incubator will be missing from Big or Deluxe Coops.
 
   |desc    = Builds the specified building at the given coordinates. Names are case-insensitive, and will list fuzzy matches if an exact match isn't found. If the name includes spaces, quote them (e.g. <samp>"Junimo Hut"</samp>). If the coordinates are not specified, it will build just to the right of your farmer. While higher-level farm buildings such as Deluxe Barns can be immediately built this way, the incubator will be missing from Big or Deluxe Coops.
 
   |example = <code>debug build "Stone Cabin"</code> would build a new Stone Cabin next to the player.
 
   |example = <code>debug build "Stone Cabin"</code> would build a new Stone Cabin next to the player.
 +
}}
 +
{{/cmd
 +
  |command = buildcoop,bc
 +
  |params  = {{t|I:X}},{{t|I:Y}}
 +
  |desc    = Tries to build a new coop at the specified position in the current location. Finishes construction instantly.
 +
}}
 +
{{/cmd
 +
  |command = finishallbuilds,fab
 +
  |desc    = Finishes all buildings under construction. Only the host player can use this command in multiplayer.
 
}}
 
}}
 
{{/cmd
 
{{/cmd
Line 2,109: Line 2,126:
 
   |params  = {{t|button}}
 
   |params  = {{t|button}}
 
   |desc    = While on the title screen, jump to a given title submenu.
 
   |desc    = While on the title screen, jump to a given title submenu.
 +
}}
 +
{{/cmd
 +
  |command = save
 +
  |desc    = Toggles saving on a new day on/off. Plays a select sound if toggled on and a deselect sound if toggled off.
 
}}
 
}}
 
{{/cmd
 
{{/cmd

entry.title: Modding:Installing SMAPI on Windows
entry.summary:
Launch SMAPI as a non-Steam game: make it clearer that these are optional instructions which most players don't need

← Older revision Revision as of 17:29, 20 March 2025
Line 34: Line 34:
  
 
====Launch SMAPI as a non-Steam game====
 
====Launch SMAPI as a non-Steam game====
−
Alternatively, you can add SMAPI as a non-Steam game if you would like separate Steam play buttons for an unmodded and modded version of the game.
+
Alternatively, you can add SMAPI as a non-Steam game to have separate play buttons in the Steam client for an unmodded and modded version of the game.
  
−
To configure it this alternate way:
+
Most players don't need to do this.
 +
 
 +
{{collapse|expand optional instructions|content= 
 
# Keep SMAPI's installer window open, as in the previous method. <br /><small>(If you already closed it, just run it again. No need to uninstall first.)</small>
 
# Keep SMAPI's installer window open, as in the previous method. <br /><small>(If you already closed it, just run it again. No need to uninstall first.)</small>
 
# Copy the text in the installer window as above, without the <code>%command%</code> portion.
 
# Copy the text in the installer window as above, without the <code>%command%</code> portion.
Line 46: Line 48:
  
 
You can now select play on StardewModdingAPI (or its alternate title) and SMAPI will launch, preserving the original "Stardew Valley" entry in your Steam Library for use in playing the unmodded game. The Steam overlay will still be available, and Steam recognizes that Stardew Valley is being run as well, adding to your playtime. Achievements will also work as usual, as Stardew Valley is recognized by Steam as being active when SMAPI is being run.
 
You can now select play on StardewModdingAPI (or its alternate title) and SMAPI will launch, preserving the original "Stardew Valley" entry in your Steam Library for use in playing the unmodded game. The Steam overlay will still be available, and Steam recognizes that Stardew Valley is being run as well, adding to your playtime. Achievements will also work as usual, as Stardew Valley is recognized by Steam as being active when SMAPI is being run.
 +
}}
  
 
===GOG Galaxy===
 
===GOG Galaxy===

entry.title: Modding talk:Player Guide/Getting Started
entry.summary:
Reminder to copy bundled mods when using multiple mod folders: add section header, re: added reminder

← Older revision Revision as of 17:27, 20 March 2025
Line 1: Line 1:
 
{{Talkheader|Modding}}
 
{{Talkheader|Modding}}
 +
 
==Modding wiki link==
 
==Modding wiki link==
 
Hello, I just tried to update the link to the Stardew Modding wiki because it moved to a different host site so the current link leads to an empty page. This was automatically prevented by this wiki though. All that needs to be done is swap `miraheze.org` out for `wiki.gg` (same goes for any other links to the modding wiki here).
 
Hello, I just tried to update the link to the Stardew Modding wiki because it moved to a different host site so the current link leads to an empty page. This was automatically prevented by this wiki though. All that needs to be done is swap `miraheze.org` out for `wiki.gg` (same goes for any other links to the modding wiki here).
Line 5: Line 6:
 
:I've done a global find & replace to update the links. Sorry for the trouble, but vandalism prevention, you know. Thanks for reporting the problem! [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 15:55, 5 July 2023 (UTC)
 
:I've done a global find & replace to update the links. Sorry for the trouble, but vandalism prevention, you know. Thanks for reporting the problem! [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 15:55, 5 July 2023 (UTC)
  
−
== Updates to "Can I Have Different Mod Groups" - Mac Platform ==
+
==Updates to "Can I Have Different Mod Groups" - Mac Platform==
−
 
 
 
Current instructions are incorrect. I was able to successfully create mod groups on my Mac by completing the following steps:
 
Current instructions are incorrect. I was able to successfully create mod groups on my Mac by completing the following steps:
 
<ol>
 
<ol>
Line 23: Line 23:
 
:: Thanks, Margotbean, it's all good. Much appreciated! [[User:Rogue.toast|Rogue.toast]] ([[User talk:Rogue.toast|talk]]) 17:52, 20 August 2023 (UTC)
 
:: Thanks, Margotbean, it's all good. Much appreciated! [[User:Rogue.toast|Rogue.toast]] ([[User talk:Rogue.toast|talk]]) 17:52, 20 August 2023 (UTC)
  
 +
==Reminder to copy bundled mods when using multiple mod folders==
 
Any mention of creating multiple Mod folders should also mention that SMAPI populates the default Mods folder with the mods "ConsoleCommands" and "SaveBackup". I was testing the compatibility of some installed mods, but then had to troubleshooting why I couldn't enter debug commands in SMAPI. [[User:DistantJragon|DistantJragon]] ([[User talk:DistantJragon|talk]]) 18:02, 18 March 2025 (UTC)
 
Any mention of creating multiple Mod folders should also mention that SMAPI populates the default Mods folder with the mods "ConsoleCommands" and "SaveBackup". I was testing the compatibility of some installed mods, but then had to troubleshooting why I couldn't enter debug commands in SMAPI. [[User:DistantJragon|DistantJragon]] ([[User talk:DistantJragon|talk]]) 18:02, 18 March 2025 (UTC)
 +
 +
: I added a reminder at the bottom of the [[Modding:Player Guide/Getting Started#Can I have different mod groups?|the mod groups section]]; how does that look? —<small>[[User:Pathoschild|Pathoschild]] ([[User talk:Pathoschild|talk]]) 17:26, 20 March 2025 (UTC)</small>

entry.title: Modding:Player Guide/Getting Started
entry.summary:
Can I have different mod groups?: add note about copying SMAPI's bundled mods

← Older revision Revision as of 17:24, 20 March 2025
(One intermediate revision by the same user not shown)
Line 292: Line 292:
  
 
===Can I have different mod groups?===
 
===Can I have different mod groups?===
−
Yep, SMAPI has built-in support for different mod groups. The instructions may seem complex, but it's easy once you get the hang of it:
+
Yep, SMAPI has built-in support for different mod groups. The instructions may seem complex, but it's easy once you get the hang of it.
  
−
For simplicity, you can also just rename the Mods folder to something else.
+
(For a quick test, you can just rename the <samp>Mods</samp> folder instead.)
  
 
{| class="wikitable"
 
{| class="wikitable"
Line 307: Line 307:
 
# Right-click the shortcut, choose <samp>Properties</samp>, and add this to the end of the <samp>Target</samp> field: <code> --mods-path "Mods (multiplayer)"</code> (changing folder name as needed). '''Don't delete any of the existing text in that field! This should be added to the end of what's already there.''' Done correctly, it should look something like <code>"your-path-here\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\Stardew Valley\StardewModdingAPI.exe" --mods-path "Mods (multiplayer)"</code>.
 
# Right-click the shortcut, choose <samp>Properties</samp>, and add this to the end of the <samp>Target</samp> field: <code> --mods-path "Mods (multiplayer)"</code> (changing folder name as needed). '''Don't delete any of the existing text in that field! This should be added to the end of what's already there.''' Done correctly, it should look something like <code>"your-path-here\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\Stardew Valley\StardewModdingAPI.exe" --mods-path "Mods (multiplayer)"</code>.
 
# Double-click that shortcut to launch SMAPI with the specified mod folder.
 
# Double-click that shortcut to launch SMAPI with the specified mod folder.
−
|-
+
 
−
| Windows (Steam, Non-Steam Game Method)
+
Tip: if you often need to switch between different folders, you can [[Modding:Installing SMAPI on Windows#Launch SMAPI as a non-Steam game|add a 'non-Steam game' launcher to Steam]] and change its launch options instead.
−
|  
 
−
# Create a separate folder for each mod group in [[#Find your game folder|your game folder]], like <code>Mods</code> and <code>Mods (multiplayer)</code>.
 
−
# Add SMAPI as a Non-Steam Game to your library a second time. Follow the second set of instructions in [[Modding:Installing SMAPI on Windows#Steam|installing SMAPI on Windows]] - it is highly suggested you alter the title in your Steam Library to differentiate between mod groups, such as "Stardew Valley Modded" and "Stardew Valley Modded Multiplayer".
 
−
# Right-click the new SMAPI entry in your Steam Library, select "Properties", and add this to the end of the Target field: <code> --mods-path "Mods (multiplayer)"</code>. '''Don't delete any of the existing text in that field! This should be added to the end of what's already there.''' Done correctly, it should look something like <code>"your-path-here\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\Stardew Valley\StardewModdingAPI.exe" --mods-path "Mods (multiplayer)"</code>.
 
−
# Click the "Play" button in the new SMAPI entry in Steam to make Steam launch SMAPI with the specified mod folder and all Steam features.
 
 
|-
 
|-
 
| Linux
 
| Linux
Line 341: Line 336:
 
<li>If you want access to all of the Steam features, make sure to launch Steam before executing the script.</li>
 
<li>If you want access to all of the Steam features, make sure to launch Steam before executing the script.</li>
 
</ol>
 
</ol>
−
|-
 
 
|}
 
|}
  
−
On Windows only, the [https://moddrop.com ModDrop] mod manager also supports up to three 'mod loadouts' which you can switch between.
+
Tips:
 +
* Don't forget to copy SMAPI's bundled Console Commands and Save Backup mods to your new folder if needed.
 +
* On Windows only, the [https://moddrop.com ModDrop] mod manager also supports up to three 'mod loadouts' which you can switch between.
  
 
{{Modding guide footer
 
{{Modding guide footer

entry.title: Modding:Installing SMAPI on Windows
entry.summary:
remove sub-sub-sections from TOC

← Older revision Revision as of 17:18, 20 March 2025
(One intermediate revision by the same user not shown)
Line 5: Line 5:
 
See instructions for: [[Modding:Installing SMAPI on Android|Android]] • [[Modding:Installing SMAPI on Linux|Linux]] • [[Modding:Installing SMAPI on Mac|macOS]] • [[Modding:Installing SMAPI on Steam Deck|Steam Deck]].
 
See instructions for: [[Modding:Installing SMAPI on Android|Android]] • [[Modding:Installing SMAPI on Linux|Linux]] • [[Modding:Installing SMAPI on Mac|macOS]] • [[Modding:Installing SMAPI on Steam Deck|Steam Deck]].
  
−
__TOC__
+
{{TOC|limit=3}}
  
 
==Install SMAPI==
 
==Install SMAPI==
Line 20: Line 20:
 
==Configure your game client==
 
==Configure your game client==
 
===Steam===
 
===Steam===
 +
====Launch SMAPI by default (recommended)====
 
You need to launch SMAPI through Steam if you want the Steam overlay, achievements, and playtime tracking to work. (If you don't care about achievements or tracking game time, you can just launch {{executable name|StardewModdingAPI}} in [[Modding:Player Guide/Getting Started#Find your game folder|your game folder]] to play with mods.)
 
You need to launch SMAPI through Steam if you want the Steam overlay, achievements, and playtime tracking to work. (If you don't care about achievements or tracking game time, you can just launch {{executable name|StardewModdingAPI}} in [[Modding:Player Guide/Getting Started#Find your game folder|your game folder]] to play with mods.)
  
Line 32: Line 33:
 
# From now on, just launch the game through Steam to run SMAPI with the Steam overlay and achievements.
 
# From now on, just launch the game through Steam to run SMAPI with the Steam overlay and achievements.
  
−
 
+
====Launch SMAPI as a non-Steam game====
 
Alternatively, you can add SMAPI as a non-Steam game if you would like separate Steam play buttons for an unmodded and modded version of the game.
 
Alternatively, you can add SMAPI as a non-Steam game if you would like separate Steam play buttons for an unmodded and modded version of the game.

entry.title: Modding:Player Guide/Getting Started
entry.summary:
Can I have different mod groups?: remove "Windows (Steam)" section (no need for a custom launch command, we're just appending an argument to the existing one)

← Older revision Revision as of 17:13, 20 March 2025
Line 307: Line 307:
 
# Right-click the shortcut, choose <samp>Properties</samp>, and add this to the end of the <samp>Target</samp> field: <code> --mods-path "Mods (multiplayer)"</code> (changing folder name as needed). '''Don't delete any of the existing text in that field! This should be added to the end of what's already there.''' Done correctly, it should look something like <code>"your-path-here\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\Stardew Valley\StardewModdingAPI.exe" --mods-path "Mods (multiplayer)"</code>.
 
# Right-click the shortcut, choose <samp>Properties</samp>, and add this to the end of the <samp>Target</samp> field: <code> --mods-path "Mods (multiplayer)"</code> (changing folder name as needed). '''Don't delete any of the existing text in that field! This should be added to the end of what's already there.''' Done correctly, it should look something like <code>"your-path-here\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\Stardew Valley\StardewModdingAPI.exe" --mods-path "Mods (multiplayer)"</code>.
 
# Double-click that shortcut to launch SMAPI with the specified mod folder.
 
# Double-click that shortcut to launch SMAPI with the specified mod folder.
−
|-
 
−
|-
 
−
| Windows (Steam)
 
−
|  
 
−
# Create a separate folder for each mod group in [[#Find your game folder|your game folder]], like <code>Mods</code> and <code>Mods (multiplayer)</code>.
 
−
# Create a shortcut to your {{executable name|steam}} file.
 
−
# Right-click the shortcut, choose <samp>Properties</samp>, and add this to the end of the <samp>Target</samp> field: <code>-applaunch 413150 --mods-path "Mods (multiplayer)"</code> (changing folder name as needed). '''Don't delete any of the existing text in that field! This should be added to the end of what's already there.''' Done correctly, it should look something like <code>"your-path-here\Steam\steam.exe" -applaunch 413150 --mods-path "Mods (multiplayer)"</code>.
 
−
# Optionally you can click the <samp>"Change Icon..."</samp> button and browse to your Stardew Valley folder to change the icon of the shortcut from the Steam icon to the Stardew Valley Icon.
 
−
# Double-click that shortcut to make Steam launch SMAPI with the specified mod folder and all steam features.

entry.title: Modding:Maps
entry.summary:
Warps & map positions: clarify that Warp affects NPCs too

← Older revision Revision as of 16:15, 20 March 2025
Line 452: Line 452:
 
|-
 
|-
 
| <samp>Warp [{{t|int fromX}} {{t|int fromY}} {{t|string toArea}} {{t|int toX}} {{t|int toY}}]+</samp><br />''(valid in any location)''
 
| <samp>Warp [{{t|int fromX}} {{t|int fromY}} {{t|string toArea}} {{t|int toX}} {{t|int toY}}]+</samp><br />''(valid in any location)''
−
| Sets the tiles which warp the player to another map (''e.g.,'' doors). The {{t|fromX}} {{t|fromY}} fields are the tile coordinates that initiate the warp, and {{t|toArea}} {{t|toX}} {{t|toY}} are the name of the in-game location to warp to and the tile coordinates within it.<br />''Example: 6 20 Mountain 76 9.''
+
| Sets the tiles which warp players or NPCs to another map (''e.g.,'' doors). The {{t|fromX}} {{t|fromY}} fields are the tile coordinates that initiate the warp, and {{t|toArea}} {{t|toX}} {{t|toY}} are the name of the in-game location to warp to and the tile coordinates within it.<br />''Example: 6 20 Mountain 76 9.''
 
|-
 
|-
 
| <samp>WarpTotemEntry[{{t|int x}} {{t|int y}}]</samp><br />''(valid in farm)''
 
| <samp>WarpTotemEntry[{{t|int x}} {{t|int y}}]</samp><br />''(valid in farm)''

entry.title: User talk:Margotbean
entry.summary:
Smoked Fish

← Older revision Revision as of 13:40, 20 March 2025
Line 204: Line 204:
 
Hi Margotbean,
 
Hi Margotbean,
  
−
Referring to the content I added to the Smoked Fish section, apologies if it read as a min-max edit, I thought maybe including information about the benefit of the artisan profession for people looking for what fish would be best to smoke, I'm happy to make a table with no reference to maximization. This table would include all fish and crab pot items that can be smoked and their base price, with fisher, with angler as well as the artisan price buff. I know it took me a while to understand which fish could be best used only as a reference and when I thought about adding this edit, I actually referenced the fish page where there is an addition exactly the same idea 'When to turn fish into Sashimi'. this is all I'm aiming to do. So, I ask that I revise my edit and make it read as it is intended (as a reference not a strategy), create the table, submit this edit for review and take any feedback as given.
+
Referring to the content I added to the Smoked Fish section, apologies if it read as a min-max edit, I thought maybe including information about the benefit of the artisan profession for people looking for what fish would be best to smoke, I'm happy to make a table with no reference to maximization. This table would include all fish and crab pot items that can be smoked and their base price, with fisher, with angler as well as the artisan price buff. I know it took me a while to understand which fish could be best used only as a reference and when I thought about adding this edit, I actually referenced the fish page where there is an addition exactly the same idea 'When to turn fish into Sashimi'. this is all I'm aiming to do. So, I ask that I revise my edit and make it read as it is intended (as a reference not a strategy), create the table, submit this edit for review and take any feedback as given. entry.title: Skull Cavern
entry.summary:
← Older revision Revision as of 13:37, 20 March 2025
Line 14: Line 14:
  
 
===Iridium===
 
===Iridium===
−
The chance to find [[Iridium Ore]] increases slowly and steadily as the player descends into the Skull Cavern, rapidly increasing from floor 10 to 100. See [[Skull Cavern/Ore Distribution]] for more details.
+
The chance to find [[Iridium Ore]] increases slowly and steadily as the player descends into the Skull Cavern, rapidly increasing from floor 10 to 100.
  
 
The monsters in the Skull Cavern also have a chance to drop [[Iridium Ore]] and [[Iridium Bar]]s, as well as [[The Mines#Special Items|special items]]. It can be a good idea to bring the [[Lava Katana]] or [[Galaxy Sword]], as enemies are particularly strong.
 
The monsters in the Skull Cavern also have a chance to drop [[Iridium Ore]] and [[Iridium Bar]]s, as well as [[The Mines#Special Items|special items]]. It can be a good idea to bring the [[Lava Katana]] or [[Galaxy Sword]], as enemies are particularly strong.

entry.title: User talk:Margotbean
entry.summary:
Smoked Fish: new section

← Older revision Revision as of 13:34, 20 March 2025
Line 199: Line 199:
 
Thanks! [[User:Eveliany|Eveliany]] ([[User talk:Eveliany|talk]]) 21:58, 17 March 2025 (UTC) Evelainy 3/17/2025 2:58pm MST
 
Thanks! [[User:Eveliany|Eveliany]] ([[User talk:Eveliany|talk]]) 21:58, 17 March 2025 (UTC) Evelainy 3/17/2025 2:58pm MST
 
:That info would belong on the [[Books]] page, with a link to Mastery, wherever it's used. Be careful not to use "exp" and "mastery" interchangeably! The convention is to use "XP" for skill points, not "exp". [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 05:56, 18 March 2025 (UTC)
 
:That info would belong on the [[Books]] page, with a link to Mastery, wherever it's used. Be careful not to use "exp" and "mastery" interchangeably! The convention is to use "XP" for skill points, not "exp". [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 05:56, 18 March 2025 (UTC)
 +
 +
== Smoked Fish ==
 +
 +
Hi Margotbean,
 +
 +
Referring to the content I added to the Smoked Fish section, apologies if it read as a min-max edit, I thought maybe including information about the benefit of the artisan profession for people looking for what fish would be best to smoke, I'm happy to make a table with no reference to maximization. This table would include all fish and crab pot items that can be smoked and their base price, with fisher, with angler as well as the artisan price buff. I know it took me a while to understand which fish could be best used only as a reference and when I thought about adding this edit, I actually referenced the fish page where there is an addition exactly the same idea 'When to turn fish into Sashimi'. this is all I'm aiming to do. So, I ask that I revise my edit and make it read as it is intended (as a reference not a strategy), create the table, submit this edit for review and take any feedback as given.

entry.title: Smoked Fish
entry.summary:
This is not a min/max guide, the prices are listed on the page

← Older revision Revision as of 12:34, 20 March 2025
Line 1: Line 1:
−
 
 
{{Infobox
 
{{Infobox
 
|eng            = Smoked Fish
 
|eng            = Smoked Fish
 
|source          = [[Artisan Goods]]
 
|source          = [[Artisan Goods]]
−
|sellprice      = 2 × [[Fish]] Sell Price (includes Quality & Artisan prices), 2.8 × with [[Artisan]] Profession
+
|sellprice      = 2 × [[Fish]] Sell Price (includes Quality & Artisan prices)
 
|ingredients    = [[File:Fish.png|24px|link=]] Any [[Fish]] (1) {{name|Coal|1}}
 
|ingredients    = [[File:Fish.png|24px|link=]] Any [[Fish]] (1) {{name|Coal|1}}
 
|edibility      =  
 
|edibility      =  
Line 21: Line 20:
 
|hate=Jas,Sebastian,Vincent
 
|hate=Jas,Sebastian,Vincent
 
}}
 
}}
−
 
−
==Fish Processing Worth==
 
−
Smoking Fish comes at the cost of one coal per fish. With the fact [[Coal]] cost 150g from [[Clint]] we can assume the worth of the fish if smoked vs their other sell methods. (Such as [[sashimi]] or selling it outright.
 
−
Keep in mind the Selling Price of the [[Fish]] is based on whether or not you have the [[Fisher]] or [[Angler]] Profession and is influenced by the [[Artisan]] Profession.
 
−
 
−
 
−
Formula used to calculate this is: '''(Sell Price * 2) - 150g''',
 
−
 
−
Example
 
−
[[Herring]] = (Base Cost) 30g, '''(30 * 2) - 150 = -90''', so it isn't worth smoking
 
−
unlike [[Octopus]] = 150g, '''(150 * 2) - 150 = 150'''.
 
−
Because it is a positive value it shows us its worth processing after factoring in coal worth.
 
−
 
−
This formula outcome changes if you have the [[Artisan]] Profession and may make some fish worth selling that previously have not been profitable, this is because as stated previously the Sell Price multiplier becomes 2.8.
 
−
 
−
Formula used then is: '''(Sell Price * 2.8) - 150g''',
 
−
Example
 
−
[[Herring]] = (Base Cost), 30g '''(30 * 2.8) - 150 = -66''', so it isn't worth smoking
 
−
unlike [[Octopus]] = 150g, '''(150 * 2.8) - 150 = 270'''.
 
  
 
==Bundles==
 
==Bundles==
